column3: Concept ACK from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20354#discussion_r570186730\n\nThere should only be one commit @brunoerg. There are currently three. You should work on top of latest version of master to avoid these merge commits but you may be able to resolve this by [squashing commits](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits)

I don't know if you need this @brunoerg but if you do you can do a reset on your branch to the current top commit on master, then re-adding your commit and force pushing.

git reset -hard `insert_current_top_commit_hash_on_master`

Then add a single commit on top and force pushing. @fanquake helped me a while back with that :)
Thanks a lot! It helped me! @michaelfolkson

Another nice catch @brunoerg!

And another case of "how the heck did this pass our peer review"? :)

Given enough eyeballs, all bugs are shallow.

Nice to have your eyeballs joining us! Again: warm welcome! :)
Got so excited that I missed my actual review comment! :D\n\ncr ACK 5e0cd25e29541e6c19559fb5c2555e008ed896fa: patch looks correct!
If this is merged we'll have to regenerate the unit tests, I presume?

> And another case of "how the heck did this pass our peer review"? :)\n\nI'm more surprised that this wasn't caught by some linter. Or is unreachable code detection in Python just not reliable enough to be useful?
> Or is unreachable code detection in Python just not reliable enough to be useful?\n\nSee f4beb4996d27f2cdaf4f0a63e7dc044bf17decce. Maybe things have changes since then?
> If this is merged we'll have to regenerate the unit tests, I presume?\n\nI don't follow this. Is a JSON dump for these used elsewhere?

> All of them are of the form:

That's allowed in Python. All variables are global or function scope; there is no scope associated with individual code blocks.

> I don't follow this. Is a JSON dump for these used elsewhere?

Yes, there is a dump extracted & minimized from the Python tests, that runs as a unit test (see src/test/script.cpp's script_asset_tests).

> If this is merge
ACK 5e0cd25e29541e6c19559fb5c2555e008ed896fa.\n\nI think this is a leftover from debugging...
